reviews.text: Bought from a supermarket in Kazakhstan. A Carlsberg Kazakhstan beer. The Kronenbourg 1664 sold in Kazakhstan by Carlsberg Kazakhstan has a 4.5% ABV. Nothing special but I do feel as though there is a unique taste despite it being a mass produced lager.

Bought in a shop in Kazakhstan. This was a rather uninspiring beer. There was nothing that bad about it but nothing good about it. It only comes in a 0.64 litre bottle and to be honest I could have done without the extra 0.14 litres as it wasnât exactly a beer to saviour.

Bought from a supermarket in Kyrgyzstan. I found it rather light and refreshing although tasting rather average and lacking any character. Towards the end I went off the taste somewhat and would therefore rate this lager just below average.
